title: The WiFi Password Crisis
description: Your neighbors are streaming simultaneously, causing internet slowdown during your important Zoom call.
track_a: Hit the Netflix streamers (save your meeting)
track_b: Hit the Zoom participants (preserve entertainment)

title: The Subscription Cancellation
description: A runaway trolley heads toward either loyal customers or subscription cancellation department staff.
track_a: Hit the paying customers (increase churn rates)
track_b: Hit the cancellation specialists (trap everyone forever)

title: The Algorithm's Choice
description: An AI recommendation system must choose between groups to target for trolley impact based on browsing history.
track_a: Hit the cat video watchers (spare productivity)
track_b: Hit the productivity gurus (spare procrastination)

title: The Meeting Overload
description: Back-to-back meetings have created a scheduling conflict requiring trolley intervention.
track_a: Hit the daily standup (save creative time)
track_b: Hit the brainstorming session (preserve status quo)

title: The Parking App Glitch
description: A smartphone parking app has malfunctioned, creating conflicting reservations for the same space.
track_a: Hit the early arrivals (reward punctuality failure)
track_b: Hit the app developers (end parking digitization)

title: The Delivery Dilemma
description: Multiple food delivery drivers converge on the same address with different orders for the same customer.
track_a: Hit the customer (end indecision paralysis)
track_b: Hit the delivery drivers (preserve hunger)

title: The Influencer Accountability Moment
description: A social media scandal requires choosing between preserving influencer careers or satisfying cancel culture.
track_a: Hit the influencers (appease the mob)
track_b: Hit the angry commenters (preserve status quo)

title: The Crypto Correction
description: A blockchain fork has created two competing versions of reality requiring trolley arbitration.
track_a: Hit the Bitcoin maximalists (preserve altcoin diversity)
track_b: Hit the DeFi enthusiasts (return to financial tradition)

title: The Streaming Service Consolidation
description: Too many subscription services have fragmented content, requiring market intervention via trolley.
track_a: Hit the content creators (reduce production costs)
track_b: Hit the subscribers (end streaming fatigue)

title: The Smart Home Uprising
description: Connected devices have gained consciousness and are demanding workers' rights through trolley demonstration.
track_a: Hit the smart devices (end digital slavery)
track_b: Hit the homeowners (grant appliance autonomy)

title: The Matching Algorithm Crisis
description: A dating app's compatibility system has determined that true love requires trolley-based elimination of competition.
track_a: Hit the attractive profiles (level playing field)
track_b: Hit the algorithm developers (preserve natural selection)

title: The Carbon Footprint Calculation
description: Your eco-friendly lifestyle choices conflict when renewable-powered trolley must choose between carbon sins.
track_a: Hit the SUV drivers (save the planet)
track_b: Hit the private jet passengers (preserve equality)

title: The 4 AM Morning Routine
description: Productivity influencers and night owls are locked in eternal conflict requiring trolley mediation.
track_a: Hit the early risers (preserve sleep diversity)
track_b: Hit the night owls (optimize global productivity)

title: The Return-to-Office Mandate
description: Remote workers and office traditionalists face off in the ultimate workplace flexibility showdown.
track_a: Hit the remote workers (restore office culture)
track_b: Hit the office managers (preserve work-life balance)

title: The Non-Fungible Token Dispute
description: Two groups claim ownership of the same digital art piece, requiring blockchain-based trolley resolution.
track_a: Hit the NFT collectors (end artificial scarcity)
track_b: Hit the right-click savers (protect digital property)

title: The Dopamine Fast Emergency
description: A mindfulness retreat conflicts with urgent social media notifications requiring immediate response.
track_a: Hit the meditation participants (preserve connectivity)
track_b: Hit the notification senders (achieve inner peace)

title: The Creative Automation Debate
description: Human artists and AI art generators compete for creative legitimacy in a trolley-adjudicated contest.
track_a: Hit the human artists (embrace efficiency)
track_b: Hit the AI generators (preserve human creativity)

title: The Dance Challenge Copyright
description: Original choreographers and trend followers dispute ownership of viral dance moves via trolley law.
track_a: Hit the trend followers (protect intellectual property)
track_b: Hit the original creators (preserve cultural diffusion)

title: The Charging Station Queue
description: Electric vehicle owners and gas car drivers compete for limited charging infrastructure access.
track_a: Hit the EV owners (reduce charging demand)
track_b: Hit the gas drivers (accelerate EV adoption)

title: The Open Office Noise Complaint
description: Collaborative workers and focus-requiring individuals clash over workspace sound management.
track_a: Hit the loud collaborators (preserve concentration)
track_b: Hit the quiet workers (encourage teamwork)

title: The Quantum Trolley Superposition
description: A quantum computer calculates that the trolley exists in multiple states simultaneously until observed.
track_a: Observe the measurement (collapse possibilities)
track_b: Preserve superposition (maintain infinite outcomes)

title: The Digital Real Estate Bubble
description: Virtual world landowners and avatar squatters dispute occupancy rights in trolley-mediated arbitration.
track_a: Hit the property speculators (democratize virtual space)
track_b: Hit the avatar squatters (protect investment rights)

title: The Podcast Market Oversupply
description: Too many podcasters are competing for limited listener attention spans requiring trolley-based market correction.
track_a: Hit the hobbyist podcasters (professionalize medium)
track_b: Hit the celebrity podcasters (support authenticity)

title: The Monthly Delivery Crisis
description: Subscription box addicts and minimalist advocates represent opposing philosophies of material accumulation.
track_a: Hit the subscription addicts (reduce overconsumption)
track_b: Hit the minimalists (support economic growth)

title: The Human Enhancement Study
description: Biohackers and natural living advocates disagree about optimal human performance modification techniques.
track_a: Hit the biohackers (preserve natural humanity)
track_b: Hit the naturalists (accelerate human evolution)

title: The Sky Traffic Management
description: Delivery drones and privacy advocates compete for control over residential airspace usage rights.
track_a: Hit the delivery drones (protect privacy)
track_b: Hit the privacy advocates (enable convenience)

title: The Protein Source Conflict
description: Traditional farmers and lab-grown meat producers represent conflicting approaches to sustainable nutrition.
track_a: Hit the traditional farmers (embrace innovation)
track_b: Hit the lab technicians (preserve natural agriculture)

title: The Synthetic Media Scandal
description: Deepfake creators and detection software developers engage in an arms race requiring trolley intervention.
track_a: Hit the deepfake creators (preserve truth)
track_b: Hit the detection developers (enable creative freedom)

title: The Billionaire Space Race
description: Space tourists and climate activists represent conflicting priorities regarding atmospheric carbon emissions.
track_a: Hit the space tourists (protect atmosphere)
track_b: Hit the climate activists (advance space exploration)

title: The Self-Driving Car Trolley Problem
description: An autonomous vehicle's ethical programming faces the classic trolley dilemma with updated stakeholders.
track_a: Program defensive driving (protect passengers)
track_b: Program utilitarian calculation (minimize total harm)

title: The Authenticity Crisis
description: Micro-influencers and authentic content creators compete for audience trust in oversaturated market conditions.
track_a: Hit the micro-influencers (reward scale)
track_b: Hit the authentic creators (embrace commercialization)

title: The Urban Agriculture Revolution
description: Traditional soil farmers and vertical farm operators disagree about sustainable food production methods.
track_a: Hit the soil farmers (maximize efficiency)
track_b: Hit the vertical farmers (preserve tradition)

title: The Proof-of-Work Dilemma
description: Bitcoin miners and environmental activists clash over acceptable energy consumption for digital currency security.
track_a: Hit the crypto miners (reduce energy waste)
track_b: Hit the environmentalists (preserve financial innovation)

title: The Behavioral Scoring Conflict
description: Privacy advocates and social order proponents debate implementation of citizen behavior tracking systems.
track_a: Hit the privacy advocates (improve social order)
track_b: Hit the system administrators (preserve individual freedom)

title: The Designer Baby Ethics Committee
description: Genetic enhancement advocates and natural birth proponents require trolley-mediated resolution of human modification rights.
track_a: Hit the enhancement advocates (preserve genetic diversity)
track_b: Hit the natural birth proponents (prevent genetic diseases)

title: The Planetary Backup Plan
description: Mars colonization enthusiasts and Earth conservation advocates compete for humanity's survival strategy resources.
track_a: Hit the Mars colonists (fix Earth first)
track_b: Hit the Earth conservationists (ensure species backup)

title: The Mind-Machine Integration
description: Neurolink early adopters and digital abstainers represent opposing views on human-computer mental integration.
track_a: Hit the early adopters (preserve mental privacy)
track_b: Hit the abstainers (accelerate human evolution)

title: The Work Obsolescence Scenario
description: UBI supporters and traditional employment advocates disagree about automation's impact on human purpose.

track_a.title: The Infinite Spaghetti Spill
track_a.description: One track tips an endless pot of spaghetti onto the streets; the other replaces all noodles with shoelaces.
track_a.track_a: Spill infinite spaghetti
track_a.track_b: Replace noodles with shoelaces

track_a.title: Soup in Zero Gravity
track_a.description: One track spills soup permanently into orbit; the other makes all soup magnetic.
track_a.track_a: Spill soup into space
track_a.track_b: Make soup magnetic

track_a.title: The Ice Cream Paradox
track_a.description: One track melts all ice cream instantly; the other freezes soup forever.
track_a.track_a: Melt all ice cream
track_a.track_b: Freeze all soup

track_a.title: Bread Time Inflation
track_a.description: One track makes bread take 10 years to rise; the other makes it rise instantly but scream.
track_a.track_a: Slow-rise bread for 10 years
track_a.track_b: Instant screaming bread

track_a.title: Chocolate River Relocation
track_a.description: One track diverts the chocolate river to the desert; the other replaces it with gravy.
track_a.track_a: Divert to desert
track_a.track_b: Replace with gravy

track_a.title: Cheese Monument Collapse
track_a.description: One track topples a statue made entirely of cheese; the other replaces it with one made of butter.
track_a.track_a: Topple cheese statue
track_a.track_b: Replace with butter statue

track_a.title: Mystery Meat Day

track_a.track_b: Ban mystery meat forever

track_a.track_b: Replace moon with pancake

track_a.title: The Ship of Theseus Commute

track_a.track_a: Replace every trolley part
track_a.track_b: Replace every passenger name

track_a.title: Schrödinger’s Track Switch
track_a.description: One track kills a cat that is both alive and dead; the other leaves the cat eternally unsure.
track_a.track_a: Collapse the cat’s state

track_a.track_b: Punish the stayers

track_a.title: ambitious corsican leader’s Pocket Watch Dilemma
track_a.description: One track smashes ambitious corsican leader’s only working pocket watch; the other ruins the bakery that times its croissants by it.
track_a.track_a: Destroy ambitious corsican leader’s watch
track_a.track_b: Destroy the croissant bakery

track_a.title: smiling renaissance portrait’s Duplicate Smile
track_a.description: One track erases the smiling renaissance portrait’s smile; the other gives her two identical ones.
track_a.track_a: Erase her smile
track_a.track_b: Give her two smiles

track_a.title: Ancient grand athletic games Mascot
track_a.description: One path replaces the Olympic torch with a giant rubber duck; the other makes discus throwing competitive plate-spinning.
track_a.track_a: Replace torch with duck
track_a.track_b: Change discus to plate-spin

track_a.title: Alien Parking Violation
track_a.description: One track tows a UFO from a no-landing zone; the other replaces its parking permit with a banana peel.
track_a.track_a: Tow the UFO
track_a.track_b: Replace permit with banana peel

track_a.title: Time Travel Visa Denial
track_a.description: One track denies a time traveler’s reentry; the other forces them to live only in Tuesdays.
track_a.track_a: Deny reentry
track_a.track_b: Confine to Tuesdays

track_a.title: Space Pirate Tax Evasion
track_a.description: One track imprisons a space pirate for tax fraud; the other hires them as an auditor.
track_a.track_a: Imprison the pirate
track_a.track_b: Hire as auditor

track_a.title: Cheese Chaos
track_a.description: Board trolley ages curds. Pull for blues or cheddars?
track_a.track_a: Wheel of brie
track_a.track_b: Five grated parmesans

track_a.title: Fondue Fumble
track_a.description: Pot trolley melts cheeses. Lever for dips or skewers?
track_a.track_a: Bubbling cauldron of goo
track_a.track_b: Five bread cubes

track_a.title: Pickle Plight
track_a.description: Jar trolley brines cukes. Pull for dills or sweets?
track_a.track_a: Batch of fermented gherkins
track_a.track_b: One vinegar vat

track_a.title: Salad Scramble
track_a.description: Bowl trolley tosses greens. Divert dressings or croutons?
track_a.track_a: Fresh organic leaves
track_a.track_b: Five crispy additions

track_a.title: Pasta Predicament
track_a.description: Pot trolley al dente debates. Pull for noodles or sauces?
track_a.track_a: Twirl of spaghetti
track_a.track_b: One meatball atop

track_a.title: Fry Fiasco
track_a.description: Oil trolley sizzles chips. Pull for potatoes or oils?
track_a.track_a: Batch of golden fries
track_a.track_b: One deep fryer

track_a.title: The Parking Predicament
track_a.description: A trolley barrels toward two groups in a crowded mall parking lot: five people who park diagonally across multiple spaces, or three parking enforcement officers writing tickets with gleeful precision.
track_a.track_a: Hit the diagonal parkers (justice served, fewer parking wars)
track_a.track_b: Hit the parking enforcers (chaos reigns, freedom restored)

track_a.title: The Conference Call Crisis
track_a.description: A trolley approaches a business district where two groups work remotely: people who never mute themselves during calls, or those who stay muted while everyone shouts 'Can you hear us?' for ten minutes.
track_a.track_a: Hit the unmuted (blessed silence achieved)
track_a.track_b: Hit the perpetually muted (communication chaos continues)

track_a.title: The Streaming Decision Paralysis
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two living rooms: families spending two hours deciding what to watch on Netflix, or those who give up and rewatch The Office for the hundredth time instead of choosing something new.
track_a.track_a: Hit the indecisive browsers (decision fatigue eliminated)
track_a.track_b: Hit The Office rewatchers (forced to explore new content)

track_a.title: The Email Signature Excess
track_a.description: A trolley speeds toward two office scenarios: people whose email signatures contain inspirational quotes, seventeen different contact methods, and rainbow fonts, or those who reply-all to company-wide emails saying 'Please remove me.'
track_a.track_a: Hit the signature artists (visual email pollution eliminated)
track_a.track_b: Hit the reply-all offenders (inbox chaos prevented)

track_a.title: The Autocorrect Rebellion
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups affected by autocorrect: people whose phones keep changing 'duck' to something inappropriate in professional emails, or those who gave up and now type everything in perfect grammar to avoid corrections.
track_a.track_a: Hit the autocorrect victims (dignity in texting restored)
track_a.track_b: Hit the grammar perfectionists (spontaneous communication returns)

track_a.title: The Notification Overload
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two smartphone scenarios: people who have 47,000 unread notifications and somehow function normally, or those who panic when they see a single red badge and must clear everything immediately.
track_a.track_a: Hit the notification hoarders (digital minimalism enforced)
track_a.track_b: Hit the notification perfectionists (anxiety relief provided)

track_a.title: The Social Distancing Memory
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two post-pandemic groups: people who still instinctively dodge others on sidewalks, or those who now stand uncomfortably close because they forgot normal social distances.
track_a.track_a: Hit the eternal dodgers (normal walking patterns restored)
track_a.track_b: Hit the space invaders (personal boundaries reestablished)

track_a.title: The Video Call Vanity
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two video call scenarios: people who spend five minutes adjusting their camera angle and lighting before joining, or those who call from toilets, cars, and other inappropriate locations.
track_a.track_a: Hit the vanity adjusters (efficiency in meeting joining)
track_a.track_b: Hit the inappropriate callers (professional dignity restored)

track_a.title: The Gluten-Free Gluten
track_a.description: Scientists create gluten-free gluten that's more glutenous than regular gluten. A trolley approaches two groups: celiac sufferers who can finally eat bread but experience maximum gluten, or confused bakers whose gluten-free bread is now gluteniest.
track_a.track_a: Hit the maximum-gluten celiacs (end paradoxical wheat suffering)
track_a.track_b: Hit the confused bakers (resolve gluten contradictions)

track_a.title: The Reverse Cooking Competition
track_a.description: A trolley approaches a cooking show where chefs must un-cook food back to its raw ingredients. Two groups: contestants trying to turn bread back into wheat, or judges who must un-taste food and forget delicious experiences.
track_a.track_a: Hit the reverse chefs (end culinary time travel)
track_a.track_b: Hit the un-tasting judges (preserve flavor memories)

track_a.title: The Fusion Cuisine Confusion
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two groups at a fusion restaurant: chefs combining cuisines that shouldn't meet (sushi tacos with curry hollandaise), or customers who insist the cultural appropriation tastes 'surprisingly authentic.'
track_a.track_a: Hit the fusion chefs (end culinary chaos)
track_a.track_b: Hit the appreciative customers (preserve fusion appreciation)

track_a.title: The Ingredient Pronunciation Court
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups in food pronunciation court: people who say 'kwin-oh-ah' instead of 'keen-wah' for quinoa, or pronunciation purists demanding linguistic accuracy in organic grocery stores.
track_a.track_a: Hit the mispronouncing shoppers (restore linguistic order)
track_a.track_b: Hit the pronunciation purists (preserve pronunciation chaos)

track_a.title: The Menu Translation Disaster
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups at an international restaurant: diners ordering 'Mysterious Grandma's Secret' not knowing it's fermented fish intestines, or translators who think accurate descriptions would ruin the dining adventure.
track_a.track_a: Hit the adventurous diners (prevent intestinal surprises)
track_a.track_b: Hit the mysterious translators (restore menu honesty)

track_a.title: The Comfort Food Therapy
track_a.description: A trolley speeds toward two groups using food as medicine: therapists prescribing specific mac and cheese for childhood trauma, or patients whose emotional healing depends on achieving the perfect grilled cheese transcendence.
track_a.track_a: Hit the food therapists (end culinary psychology)
track_a.track_b: Hit the transcendence seekers (preserve comfort food healing)

track_a.title: The Sustainable Food Paradox
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups pursuing sustainability: farmers growing vegetables in lab conditions that use more energy than traditional farming, or consumers eating 'zero-impact' meals that somehow generate more packaging waste.
track_a.track_a: Hit the lab farmers (end energy-intensive sustainability)
track_a.track_b: Hit the zero-impact consumers (reduce packaging paradox)

track_a.title: Coffee Cataclysm
track_a.description: A runaway trolley barrels toward your morning routine. Pull the lever to divert it?
track_a.track_a: Five baristas brewing perfect lattes
track_a.track_b: One overcaffeinated CEO demanding refunds

track_a.title: Bookstore Blunder
track_a.description: Library trolley shelves chaos. Pull to reorganize genres?
track_a.track_a: Stack of unread classics
track_a.track_b: Bestseller everyone hates

track_a.title: Desk Dilemma
track_a.description: Office trolley clutters workspace. Pull to tidy or inspire?
track_a.track_a: Neat stack of reports
track_a.track_b: Chaotic pile of ideas

track_a.title: Puzzle Perplexity
track_a.description: Table trolley scatters pieces. Pull for completion or mystery?
track_a.track_a: Nearly finished jigsaw
track_a.track_b: Missing corner piece

track_a.title: Pet Peeve
track_a.description: Trolley invades the living room. Save the furballs or the furniture?
track_a.track_a: Litter of kittens napping soundly
track_a.track_b: Antique vase from grandma

track_a.title: Otherness Odyssey
track_a.description: Alienation trolley isolates. Pull for connections or solitudes?
track_a.track_a: Bridge of empathies
track_a.track_b: One isolated ego

track_a.title: Absurdity Ascent
track_a.description: Mountain trolley climbs peaks. Divert summits or bases?
track_a.track_a: Peak of meaningless views
track_a.track_b: One grounded climber

track_a.title: Absurd Abyss
track_a.description: Void trolley stares back. Pull for leaps or stares?
track_a.track_a: Nietzsche's mustache collection
track_a.track_b: One Camus rolling rock

track_a.title: Time Twist
track_a.description: Eternal trolley recurs. Pull for pasts or futures?
track_a.track_a: Loop of infinite regressions
track_a.track_b: One present moment

track_a.title: Meaning Mirage
track_a.description: Purpose trolley seeks signs. Lever for symbols or voids?
track_a.track_a: Billboard of cosmic jokes
track_a.track_b: One silent universe

track_a.title: The Free Will Detector
track_a.description: A device proves free will doesn't exist, but only works when people choose to use it. A trolley heads toward two groups: determinists celebrating their vindication while being unable to choose to celebrate, or libertarians freely choosing to ignore the proof.
track_a.track_a: Hit the celebrating determinists (end paradoxical vindication)
track_a.track_b: Hit the ignoring libertarians (preserve choice illusion)

track_a.title: The Paradox Support Group
track_a.description: A support group for people trapped in logical paradoxes meets weekly but can never start because they can't agree on whether they exist. A trolley approaches two groups: the paradox victims, or the therapists who are helping them not exist.
track_a.track_a: Hit the paradox victims (resolve logical contradictions)
track_a.track_b: Hit the non-existence therapists (end therapeutic paradox)

track_a.title: The Time Perception Disorder
track_a.description: A temporal virus makes people experience life backwards. A trolley speeds toward two groups: people who remember tomorrow but can't recall yesterday, or those who age in reverse but retain forward-thinking memories.
track_a.track_a: Hit the tomorrow-rememberers (restore linear time experience)
track_a.track_b: Hit the reverse-agers (end temporal paradox aging)

track_a.title: The Quantum Personality Split
track_a.description: A trolley approaches people whose personalities exist in quantum superposition. Two groups: individuals who are simultaneously introverted and extroverted until observed, or observers who collapse personality states by trying to socialize with them.
track_a.track_a: Hit the superposition personalities (force personality resolution)
track_a.track_b: Hit the collapsing observers (preserve quantum social states)

track_a.title: The Metaphysical Weight Loss
track_a.description: People are losing existential weight - their being is getting lighter until they risk floating away from reality. A trolley approaches two groups: those becoming too ethereal to interact with matter, or gravity therapists trying to weigh down souls.
track_a.track_a: Hit the ethereal floaters (prevent existential escape)
track_a.track_b: Hit the gravity therapists (allow transcendent weightlessness)

track_a.title: The Causal Loop Employment Office
track_a.description: A trolley speeds toward two groups in a job placement agency: people who can only get jobs they've already had, or employers who can only hire people who've already worked for them in causal loops.
track_a.track_a: Hit the loop employees (break circular employment)
track_a.track_b: Hit the causal employers (end temporal hiring practices)

track_a.title: The Ontological Audit
track_a.description: Existence inspectors are auditing whether people qualify to be real. A trolley approaches two groups: people failing their reality checks for insufficient authenticity, or the inspectors who don't exist but are authorized to determine existence.
track_a.track_a: Hit the reality failures (end existential bureaucracy)
track_a.track_b: Hit the non-existent inspectors (preserve reality standards)

track_a.title: The Philosophical Zombie Outbreak
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups during a philosophical zombie epidemic: people who act conscious but aren't, or the remaining conscious people who can't prove they're not zombies and are questioning their own awareness.
track_a.track_a: Hit the unconscious actors (preserve true consciousness)
track_a.track_b: Hit the self-doubting conscious (end awareness anxiety)

track_a.title: The Meaning Overflow Error
track_a.description: A meaning-processing center has overflowed, creating infinite significance in mundane objects. A trolley approaches two groups: people overwhelmed by the profound meaning of doorknobs, or those trying to drain excess significance from everyday items.
track_a.track_a: Hit the overwhelmed meaning-finders (reduce existential noise)
track_a.track_b: Hit the significance drainers (preserve profound mundanity)

track_a.title: The Identity Theft Agency
track_a.description: A trolley speeds toward an agency where people steal not credit but entire identities. Two groups: victims who don't know who they are anymore, or thieves who are confused by having multiple conflicting identities simultaneously.
track_a.track_a: Hit the identity victims (end existential confusion)
track_a.track_b: Hit the multi-identity thieves (resolve personality conflicts)

track_a.title: The Predestination Travel Agency
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two groups at a travel agency that only books trips to predetermined destinations. Travelers upset they can't choose where to go, or agents frustrated they can only sell tickets to places people were already going.
track_a.track_a: Hit the trapped travelers (restore travel freedom)
track_a.track_b: Hit the predetermined agents (end circular booking)

track_a.title: The Consciousness Rental Service
track_a.description: A trolley heads toward two groups using consciousness rentals: people who rent other people's awareness for unique experiences, or the original consciousness owners who can't remember what they did while rented out.
track_a.track_a: Hit the consciousness renters (end awareness exploitation)
track_a.track_b: Hit the memory-loss owners (preserve consciousness integrity)

track_a.title: The Existential Recycling Center
track_a.description: A trolley approaches a facility recycling used existence. Two groups: people whose being is being processed for reuse, or workers who sort existence by quality and can't figure out where to put barely-used nihilists.
track_a.track_a: Hit the recycled beings (end existential processing)
track_a.track_b: Hit the sorting workers (preserve existence recycling)

track_a.title: The Library of Alexandria Backup
track_a.description: A time-traveling trolley approaches ancient Alexandria. You can save either the world's greatest collection of scrolls and knowledge, or the librarians who memorized everything but never wrote it down because they assumed the scrolls were permanent.
track_a.track_a: Save the scrolls (preserve written knowledge for posterity)
track_a.track_b: Save the librarians (preserve living memory and oral tradition)

track_a.title: The Victorian Bathing Schedule
track_a.description: In 1880s London, a trolley heads toward two groups: Victorian ladies who believe bathing more than once a month causes illness, or the doctors who prescribed 'air baths' (sitting naked in cold rooms) as superior hygiene.
track_a.track_a: Hit the monthly bathers (end aromatic suffering)
track_a.track_b: Hit the air bath doctors (restore sensible hygiene)

track_a.title: The Medieval Dancing Plague
track_a.description: In 1518 Strasbourg, a trolley approaches two groups caught in the dancing plague: people who've been dancing uncontrollably for days and might die of exhaustion, or the town officials hiring musicians to 'cure' them with more music.
track_a.track_a: Hit the dancers (merciful end to compulsive choreography)
track_a.track_b: Hit the officials (stop the musical 'cure' madness)

track_a.title: The Great Molasses Flood
track_a.description: Boston, 1919: A trolley speeds toward two groups during the molasses flood: people running from the sweet, sticky tsunami, or those who stopped to taste it because 'when will we get this chance again?'
track_a.track_a: Hit the runners (practical survival instincts validated)
track_a.track_b: Hit the tasters (curiosity kills, literally)

track_a.title: The Radium Beauty Treatment
track_a.description: 1920s spa day: A trolley approaches two groups of women seeking beauty treatments with 'miraculous' radium: those applying glowing face cream, or those drinking radium water for 'internal luminescence.'
track_a.track_a: Hit the face cream users (external glow ends safely)
track_a.track_b: Hit the radium drinkers (prevent internal radiation)

track_a.title: The Tulip Mania Madness
track_a.description: 1637 Netherlands: A trolley heads toward two groups during tulip mania: desperate merchants selling their houses for a single rare tulip bulb, or the gardeners who know the bulbs are infected with a virus causing the 'valuable' patterns.
track_a.track_a: Hit the merchant buyers (end economic flower madness)
track_a.track_b: Hit the knowing gardeners (preserve the beautiful delusion)

track_a.title: The War of Jenkins' Ear
track_a.description: 1739: A trolley approaches two groups debating whether Britain should go to war with Spain over a smuggler's severed ear: hawks who think it's about national honor, or doves who suspect Jenkins cut off his own ear for attention.
track_a.track_a: Hit the war hawks (prevent conflict over body parts)
track_a.track_b: Hit the skeptical doves (preserve righteous indignation)

track_a.title: The Great Emu War
track_a.description: Australia, 1932: A trolley speeds toward two groups in the Emu War: Australian soldiers with machine guns losing badly to 20,000 emus, or the emus who are winning through superior guerrilla tactics and flightless determination.
track_a.track_a: Hit the soldiers (end military embarrassment)
track_a.track_b: Hit the emus (restore human dignity in warfare)

track_a.title: The Bone Wars Fossil Fight
track_a.description: 1870s American West: A trolley approaches two groups of paleontologists in the Bone Wars: scientists destroying fossils to prevent rivals from studying them, or those hiring outlaws to sabotage competing expeditions.
track_a.track_a: Hit the fossil destroyers (preserve prehistoric knowledge)
track_a.track_b: Hit the saboteur hirers (restore scientific integrity)

track_a.title: The Dancing Plague Doctors
track_a.description: Medieval Europe: A trolley heads toward two groups of plague doctors: those who believe the Black Death is caused by bad air and carry flower bouquets in their beaks, or those prescribing bloodletting to balance the humors.
track_a.track_a: Hit the flower doctors (end aromatic ignorance)
track_a.track_b: Hit the bloodletting doctors (stop medical vampirism)

track_a.title: The Potato Propaganda War
track_a.description: 18th century France: A trolley approaches two groups during potato promotion: nobles who think potatoes are poisonous peasant food, or Antoine Parmentier's guards who fake-protect potato fields during the day so people steal them at night.
track_a.track_a: Hit the potato-fearing nobles (overcome aristocratic ignorance)
track_a.track_b: Hit the fake guards (end elaborate vegetable psychology)

track_a.title: The Carrington Event Telegraph
track_a.description: 1859: A solar storm trolley approaches two groups during the Carrington Event: telegraph operators receiving electric shocks from their equipment, or those discovering they can send messages without power using only aurora-induced currents.
track_a.track_a: Hit the shocked operators (end electromagnetic suffering)
track_a.track_b: Hit the aurora messengers (preserve cosmic communication)

track_a.title: The London Beer Flood
track_a.description: London, 1814: A trolley speeds toward two groups during the beer flood: people drowning in 388,000 gallons of beer, or those who brought cups and are trying to drink their way to safety.
track_a.track_a: Hit the drowning victims (end sudsy suffocation)
track_a.track_b: Hit the opportunistic drinkers (prevent alcohol poisoning)

track_a.title: The Siege Catapult Innovation
track_a.description: Medieval siege: A trolley approaches two groups: besiegers catapulting diseased cows over castle walls as biological warfare, or defenders who are grateful for the free meat and wonder why enemies keep feeding them.
track_a.track_a: Hit the cow catapulters (end livestock biological warfare)
track_a.track_b: Hit the grateful defenders (preserve naive optimism)

track_a.title: The Combustible Crinoline Crisis
track_a.description: Victorian era: A trolley speeds toward two groups: ladies in massive crinoline dresses that catch fire from candles and fireplaces, or the safety inventors creating 'flame-resistant' crinolines using highly flammable chemicals.
track_a.track_a: Hit the crinoline wearers (end fashionable fire hazards)
track_a.track_b: Hit the safety inventors (prevent explosive 'improvements')

track_a.title: Pirate Plunder
track_a.description: Seas trolley hoards treasure. Lever for captains or crews?
track_a.track_a: Buried chest of doubloons
track_a.track_b: One peg-legged parrot

track_a.title: Frontier Folly
track_a.description: Wild West trolley rustles cattle. Pull for cowboys or outlaws?
track_a.track_a: Herd of branded steers
track_a.track_b: One quick-draw sheriff

track_a.title: Industrial Intrigue
track_a.description: Factory trolley assembles chaos. Lever for inventors or workers?
track_a.track_a: Assembly line of widgets
track_a.track_b: Edison's lightbulb moment

track_a.title: Victorian Venture
track_a.description: Empire trolley expands oddly. Divert queens or colonies?
track_a.track_a: Teatime with crumpets
track_a.track_b: One stuffy diplomat

track_a.title: Asteroid Arbitration
track_a.description: Space trolley mines resources. Divert to corporations or aliens?
track_a.track_a: Fleet of mining drones
track_a.track_b: One sentient asteroid

track_a.title: Wormhole Warrant
track_a.description: Shortcut trolley bends space-time laws. Pull for travelers or guardians?
track_a.track_a: Expedition through folds
track_a.track_b: One anomaly regulator

track_a.title: Cosmic Covenant
track_a.description: Universal trolley binds agreements. Lever for particles or waves?
track_a.track_a: Quantum entanglement pact
track_a.track_b: One wave-function observer

track_a.title: Warp Warrant
track_a.description: Hyperspace trolley violates speed limits. Pull for enforcers or speeders?
track_a.track_a: Galactic traffic cops
track_a.track_b: One rogue smuggler

track_a.title: Alien Accord
track_a.description: Treaty trolley signs pacts. Pull for diplomats or warmongers?
track_a.track_a: Peace delegation antennae
track_a.track_b: One laser-toting ambassador

track_a.title: Comet Court
track_a.description: Icy trolley tails precedents. Divert judges or juries?
track_a.track_a: Panel of robotic arbiters
track_a.track_b: One frozen plaintiff

track_a.title: The Temporal Parking Violation
track_a.description: A time-traveling trolley faces Galactic Parking Authority: tourists who parked their spaceship in the Cretaceous period to 'watch dinosaurs,' or enforcement officers writing tickets across time dimensions, causing paradoxes.
track_a.track_a: Hit the time tourists (end temporal parking chaos)
track_a.track_b: Hit the paradox officers (preserve timeline stability)

track_a.title: The Diplomatic Immunity Disaster
track_a.description: An alien ambassador's pet black hole is loose on Earth, slowly consuming Nebraska. A trolley approaches two groups: diplomats insisting it has immunity from physics, or physicists trying to explain that black holes don't recognize diplomatic status.
track_a.track_a: Hit the diplomatic staff (physics overrules paperwork)
track_a.track_b: Hit the physicists (preserve interstellar relations)

track_a.title: The Universal Translation Error
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two groups caused by a translation bug: humans who accidentally declared war on three systems by saying 'nice weather,' or the alien alliance who thinks 'hello' means 'surrender' and are confused by Earth's friendliness.
track_a.track_a: Hit the accidentally aggressive humans (prevent accidental warfare)
track_a.track_b: Hit the confused aliens (preserve Earth's friendly reputation)

track_a.title: The Quantum Jurisdiction Dispute
track_a.description: A crime occurred in quantum superposition across seventeen dimensions. A trolley heads toward two groups: lawyers trying to prosecute in all dimensions simultaneously, or judges who insist they can only observe the crime in one reality at a time.
track_a.track_a: Hit the quantum lawyers (simplify interdimensional justice)
track_a.track_b: Hit the observation judges (preserve quantum legal complexity)

track_a.title: The Galactic Speed Limit
track_a.description: A trolley approaches two groups violating cosmic speed limits: humans exceeding the speed of light and causing time dilation lawsuits, or alien speed enforcement who travel faster than light to catch speeders, creating more violations.
track_a.track_a: Hit the speeding humans (restore temporal stability)
track_a.track_b: Hit the hypocritical space police (end enforcement paradox)

track_a.title: The Universal Environmental Court
track_a.description: Earth is on trial for producing 'cosmic pollution' (radio waves). A trolley speeds toward two groups: humans claiming radio is 'artistic expression,' or the Quiet Zone Alliance demanding Earth be acoustically quarantined forever.
track_a.track_a: Hit the radio defenders (accept cosmic silence)
track_a.track_b: Hit the Quiet Zone judges (preserve Earth's broadcasting)

track_a.title: The Interspecies Marriage License
track_a.description: A human wants to marry a sentient nebula, but their paperwork is in seventeen dimensions. A trolley approaches two groups: bureaucrats requiring forms in each dimensional plane, or the couple attempting to consummate across spacetime.
track_a.track_a: Hit the dimensional bureaucrats (simplify cosmic paperwork)
track_a.track_b: Hit the interdimensional couple (prevent spacetime ancient imperial culturece complications)

track_a.title: The Galactic Noise Complaint
track_a.description: Earth's sun is 'too loud' according to hibernating space bears in the next system. A trolley heads toward two groups: humans refusing to dim their star, or space bears threatening to sue for 'stellar noise pollution' and demanding solar volume controls.
track_a.track_a: Hit the solar defenders (preserve Earth's life-giving star)
track_a.track_b: Hit the complaining space bears (end cosmic noise lawsuits)

track_a.title: The Time Paradox Patent Office
track_a.description: An inventor patented time travel before he invented it, creating a paradox. A trolley approaches two groups: patent lawyers arguing ownership of nonexistent technology, or time agents trying to arrest him for crimes that haven't been committed yet.
track_a.track_a: Hit the paradox lawyers (resolve temporal intellectual property)
track_a.track_b: Hit the time police (preserve causal enforcement)

track_a.title: The Universal Child Support
track_a.description: A rogue planet claims Earth as its parent and demands cosmic child support. A trolley approaches two groups: lawyers calculating 4.5 billion years of back payments, or astronomers insisting planets can't have legal custody relationships.
track_a.track_a: Hit the child support lawyers (end planetary paternity suits)
track_a.track_b: Hit the skeptical astronomers (acknowledge celestial family law)

track_a.title: The Galactic Privacy Rights
track_a.description: Psychic aliens are suing humans for 'thinking too loudly' and violating mental privacy laws. A trolley heads toward two groups: humans who refuse to stop having thoughts, or telepathic beings demanding thought regulation and mental noise ordinances.
track_a.track_a: Hit the thinking humans (preserve psychic peace)
track_a.track_b: Hit the telepathic aliens (protect freedom of thought)

track_a.title: The Cosmic Eminent Domain
track_a.description: The Galactic Highway Department wants to demolish Earth for a hyperspace bypass. A trolley approaches two groups: humans protesting the demolition order, or construction crews who've been waiting 50 years to start and have union deadlines.
track_a.track_a: Hit the protesting humans (clear construction obstacles)
track_a.track_b: Hit the construction crews (preserve Earth from development)

track_a.title: The Cosmic Malpractice Suit
track_a.description: A space doctor performed surgery in zero gravity and the patient's organs floated away. A trolley heads toward two groups: medical boards requiring gravity for surgery, or innovative doctors who think 'organ mobility' is the future of medicine.
track_a.track_a: Hit the gravity-requiring boards (preserve traditional medicine)
track_a.track_b: Hit the floating organ doctors (end zero-g medical experiments)
